result.execSummary:
The defendant Vickie L Kreklow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In cases 15CM256 count #1 and case 15CM386 count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $584.50 (total for both cases $1169.00), plus court appointed attorney fees,  to be paid in $50 due every other month installments commencing on 4/1/17 and on the 1st day of every other month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term.

[post hearing off record: in response to the clerks inquiry, the Court clarifies that the 5 day alternate sentence is as to each case, and that those 5 day jail terms are concurrent with each other].

***** Per 3/15/17 Order for Payment of Atty. Attorney Rhiel as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $65.10 for case 15CM386*****
The Court requires the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vickie L Kreklow

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:
[JK] cases 15CM256 and 15CM386 called at 10:18am
Defendant Vickie L Kreklow in court with Attorney John Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; in case 15CM256 plea of " Guilty " entered on count #1; in case 15CM386 plea of " Guilty " entered on count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
DA Happ submits a victim impact statement regarding case 15CM256.
Sentencing arguments are given

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses count #2 in case 15CM256.

In cases 15CM256 count #1 and case 15CM386 count #1 each, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $584.50 (total for both cases $1169.00), plus court appointed attorney fees, to be paid in $50 installments due every other month commencing on 4/1/17 and on the 1st day of every other month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term.
The Court requires the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.
In case 15CM256 only: the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution in the amount of $58, in favor of Alyssa Kreklow.
recess: 10:53am
[post hearing off record: in response to the clerks inquiry, the Court clarifies that the 5 day alternate sentence is as to each case, and that those 5 day jail terms are concurrent with each other].
Status conference on February 24, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #15CM256 and #15CM386 called at 11:17am.
Defendant Vickie L Kreklow in court with Attorney John Rhiel.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry of Ms. Kreklow regarding non-payment of the required attorney fee reimbursement installment payments, Ms. Kreklow indicates that she has been off work due to health issues. Ms. Kreklow has been in contact with the Clerk of Courts Bookkeeper and has indicated that she will make a payment at the end of this month. 
The Court directs Ms. Kreklow to make a payment by the end of this month. 
Attorney Rhiel indicates that the parties are working toward a resolution.  Attorney Rhiel requests the scheduling of another status- this will likely become a plea and sentencing hearing .
The Court continues the conditions of Bail. 
recess 11:19am.

NEXT:  Status Conference on both cases (likely plea/sentencing) on 2/24/17 at 10:00am.
In response to 1-6-17 Bookkeeping Memorandum - Address the Non Compliance at the next hearing
Status conference on January 13, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Vickie will be in on the 18th to make payment.

The Petition is GRANTED because the court finds the person is currently indigent. An attorney shall be appointed at county expense as set forth below. The person shall be required to reimburse the county for such representation as follows - Repayment at the rate of $50  per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on     10-31-2016 . Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court
